intro: Kokia kauaiensis, commonly known as the Kauai kokia, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Kauai in Hawaii. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its distinctive pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant is known for its striking violet-blue flowers and is often found growing in coastal areas and dry forests. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is classified as critically endangered. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect and propagate this unique species.
